**Stone Gables Roof Replacement Tender Announcement**
------------------------------------------------%)

### Important Details
- **Reference Number**: cb-315-33346536
- **Tender Closing Date**: December 12, 2024, 10:00 AM
- **Expected Contract Start Date**: December 20, 2024
- **Expected Contract End Date**: February 1, 2025

### Description
The Correctional Service of Canada has issued a tender for the replacement of the roof at the Stone Gables building in Kingston, Ontario.

### Objective
The objective of the tender is to engage a qualified roofing contractor to remove and replace the existing roof finishes, flashings, deck protection, and trims at the Stone Gables building.

### Scope of Work
The work includes:

- Removal and disposal of existing asphalt shingles, tar paper, trims, and valley flashings
- Supply and installation of new plywood as required
- Supply and installation of ice and water shield on all eaves, valleys, and around chimneys
- Supply and installation of synthetic vapour barrier over the entire roof deck
- Supply and installation of new valley steel and eave starter
- Supply and installation of new fibreglass architectural shingles
- Supply and installation of roll ridge venting on all peaks
- Supply and installation of all neoprene's and caulking as required to make the replacement roofing system watertight
- Provision of a minimum 1-year warranty on workmanship and materials

### Important Dates
- The deadline for submission is December 12, 2024, 10:00 AM
- The expected start date of the contract is December 20, 2024
- The expected end date of the contract is February 1, 2025

### Contact Information
For any queries or clarifications, please contact Robin Riha at robin.riha@csc-scc.gc.ca or (613) 328-9727.

### Bidding Requirements
- Tender packages can be downloaded from the Canada buys/tender opportunities website
- Interested suppliers can submit their bid electronically or by mail
- Bidders are advised to review the solicitation document and associated documents carefully before submitting their bid

### Trade Agreement
This procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
